fr.SDG_GOAL: Objectif 12. Établir des modes de consommation et de production durables

fr.CONTACT_ORGANISATION: Institut de Statistiques et d’Etudes Economiques du Burundi (ISTEEBU)

fr.STAT_CONC_DEF: Différence entre le taux brut de natalité et le taux brut de mortalité. Il mesure l'augmentation d'une population au cours d'une période donnée du fait uniquement des naissances et des décès

fr.COMPARABILITY: L’indicateur peut être comparé aux autres indicateurs du même type au niveau régional et international

SDG_GOAL: Objective 12. Establish sustainable consumption and production patterns
SDG_TARGET: 12.2 By 2030, achieve sustainable management and rational use of natural resources
CONTACT_ORGANISATION: Burundi Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies (ISTEEBU)
ORGANISATION_UNIT: Social studies and statistics and poverty monitoring (ESSSP)
STAT_CONC_DEF: Difference between crude birth rate and crude death rate. It measures the increase of a population over a period of time due only to births and deaths
FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)
COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
RATIONALE: This indicator is relevant because it highlights the difference between the crude birth rate and the crude death rate. It measures the increase of a population over a period of time due only to births and deaths
REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive. The indicator cannot be calculated by gender.
DATA_COMP: It is the difference between the crude birth rate and the crude death rate. It measures the increase of a population over a period of time due only to births and deaths
DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level
COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
